snippet: A season of warmer ocean waters that has been expected to produce a Niño episode and perhaps bring relief from the drought may turn out to be a bit weaker than advertised.
abstract: Climate experts see signs that El Nino, a climate pattern caused by warmer ocean waters that can drive wetter weather, is coming, but say they expect a weak episode, offering little relief from the drought that has gripped the United States.
lead_paragraph: A season of warmer ocean waters that has been expected to produce a Niño episode and perhaps bring relief from the drought may turn out to be a bit weaker than advertised.

headline.seo: Experts See Signs of El Niño, but a Weak One
headline.main: Experts See Signs of El Niño, but a Weak One
headline.print_headline: Climate Experts See Signs That El Niño Is Coming, but Expect a Weakling
